timeline.message: Fix test weirdness that was confusing Android Studio

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * Common HTTP pipeline used by service clients.
          
          
            
             * Common HTTP pipeline components used by service clients.
timeline.author: vcolin7
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,7 @@
+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License.
+
+/**
+ * Common HTTP pipeline used by service clients.

timeline.bodyText: Did we figure out a way to share test classes from Azure Core?
timeline.author: vcolin7

replies.bodyText: Yep. I copied them over. This works, but if you re-import the project into Android Studio it no longer understands the project structure of Core because it mistakenly thinks that the src directory belongs to azure-storage-blob. Building from the commandline still works fine obviously, it's just a mistake in how Studio infers the project structure from the gradle files. I wasn't able to correct it either, "modules" section of the project structure dialog didn't show any of the libraries any more. After a couple hours knocking my head against the desk I figured out this line was causing the issue.
replies.author: bsiegel

timeline.bodyText:
Should this be capitalized like what we do with Azure Communication Services?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * Credential objects used with Azure Blob storage service clients to authorize requests.
          
          
            
             * Credential objects used with Azure Blob Storage Service clients to authorize requests.
timeline.author: vcolin7
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License.
+// Code generated by Microsoft (R) AutoRest Code Generator.
+
+/**
+ * Credential objects used with Azure Blob storage service clients to authorize requests.

replies.bodyText:
Maybe? Even the official docs page mixes the casing: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/storage/blobs/
But I think it makes sense for consistency. I will correct.
replies.author: bsiegel

timeline.bodyText: Are we planning on using single quotes across our Gradle files?
timeline.author: vcolin7

replies.bodyText: Generally I follow the advice of Ruby which also has this distinction (single quotes are literals, double quotes allow interpolation) and use single quotes everywhere I don't intend for interpolation to occur. That said, I only changed them here because I was already re-ordering them. I considered changing them everywhere but felt that was too disruptive for this PR.
replies.author: bsiegel
